rule.name: Disambiguate time no. 2
rule.example: It's half past six.

rule.name: so + adj/rb => so/RB

rule.name: Interjections
rule.example: Out!

rule.name: VB_OUT => not a verb
rule.example: He always left himself an out.
Go out!

rule.name: VB_EXCEPT => not a verb

rule.name: except do => verb

There was nothing he could do except jump into the ditch.

rule.name: go + verb/nn => verb
rule.example: I told him, I want to go see the Buck house.

rule.name: go ape => NN:UN

rule.name: go to + noun without determiner =>NN:UN

rule.name: hat in hand => no determiner required
above/below ground => no determiner required

rule.name: at + nouns that require no determiner
rule.example: We were at the university.
This happened at night.

rule.name: beyond + nouns that require no determiner
rule.example: It's beyond your control.
It's beyond reach.

rule.name: beyond + nouns that require no determiner
rule.example: It's beyond your control.
It's beyond description.

rulegroup.name: by + nouns that require no determiner

rule.example: She played chess with him by postcard.

rulegroup.name: for + nouns that require no determiner

rule.example: For example, he plays golf.

rule.name: 'in as parts of proper names

But a tossing of coins, with perhaps the added safeguard of reference to the oracles of the I Ching, the Chinese Book Of Changes, dictates the handling of the chosen materials.

rule.name: You guys =>NNS
rule.example: You are fine.
You guys remember that.
It was a gift for he.
It is nice, for he does a lot of nice things.
It was a gift for he.
It is nice, for they do a lot of nice things.

rule.name: Do washing
rule.example: I like washing dishes.
They did washing.

rule.name: orders > noun
rule.example: These are my orders.
You cannot disobey orders!

rule.name: preposition + training =>noun
rule.example: I'm training now.
We need to to pay for training to meet national skilled manpower needs.

rule.name: will as modal verb
rule.example: This road will designated.
I will do it.

I was one who did not conform, and whose will could not be broken.

... control of thought, feelings and will combined with openness, tolerance and flexibility.
By the way, what will are you talking about?
Remind me, what will are these people contesting?

rule.name: noun/adj + noun => adj + noun
rule.example: This is a nice machine.
Is much powerful and wondrous magic necessary for Harry Potter to fly?
The circus will come to town tomorrow.
His party may have brought the disease with them from Egypt.
This component parts the wires automatically.

Noun. ... will need to start over at time period three.
Noun: Otherwise, the community sees it as trolling, regardless of the intent.
Noun: Also, this group sees them on many occasions.
Noun: Before the game starts she is unable to read all instructions.
Noun: The work makes it possible.

rule.name: to + noun/verb > verb + and/or + noun/verb > verb
rule.example: ... and is applicable to oil or sludge.
... and is applicable to sludge or water in such conditions.
... and is applicable to milk and water (as shown on page 3).

This did not apply to oil or water glass because the...
This does not apply to oil and water mixtures because the...
This test is not applicable to blue or black oil, except on Mondays.
So feel free to open and account at languagetoolplus.com.
... making its purpose difficult to abstract or quantify to any single concept.
It is not easy to check and control these decisions.
Although to summarize and abstract the information is not easy...
If you want to blacken or blue the metal, you must...

rule.name: past participle + to + noun/verb > verb + preposition
rule.example: A three-man committee has recommended to Commission Chairman Charles O. Emmerich...
We have suggested to Peter on many occasions to do more tests.
They were committed to Water at this time in their fast.
The banks were said to flood when Aquarius put his jar into the river.
You are generally expected to sleep at night.
Sheep are often erroneously believed to dream when they graze in the fields.

rule.example: ... and the ashes urn was broken.

... known as the Ashes is a Test cricket series played between England and Australia.

rule.name: Ignore spelling of superscripted units of measure
Ignore spelling of Hispanic names containing 'de'
Ignore spelling of Hispanic names containing 'del'
the blessed
rule.example: Oh, the blessed fool really annoys me.

rule.name: status quo
rule.example: I think that Status Quo was one of the best bands I listened to.
I think that the status quo is not satisfactory.

rulegroup.name: Adverbial phrases at the start of a sentence
